revisions.rev:
{{Israeli people}} This is a '''list of prominent [[Israel]]is'''
==Historical figures==
===Politicians=== {{see also|List of Israeli politicians}} * [[Chaim Weizmann]] â first [[President of Israel]] (1949â52) * [[Yitzhak Ben-Zvi]] â first elected/second president [[President of Israel]] (1952â63) * [[David Ben-Gurion]] â first [[Prime Minister of Israel]] (1948â54, 1955â63) * [[Moshe Sharett]] â prime minister (1954â55) * [[Levi Eshkol]] â prime minister (1963â69) * [[Abba Eban]] â diplomat and [[Foreign Affairs Minister of Israel]] (1966â74) * [[Golda Meir]] â prime minister (1969â74) * [[Yitzhak Rabin]] â prime minister (1974â77, 1992â95); [[Nobel Peace Prize]] (1994) (assassinated November 1995) * [[Menachem Begin]] â prime minister (1977â83); Nobel Peace Prize (1978) * [[Yitzhak Shamir]] â prime minister (1983â84, 1986â92) * [[Shimon Peres]] â [[President of Israel]] (2007â); prime minister (1984â86, 1995â96); Nobel Peace Prize (1994) * [[Benjamin Netanyahu]] â prime minister (1996â99), (2009â); was minister of finance; Likud party chairman * [[Ehud Barak]] â prime minister (1999â01) * [[Moshe Katsav]] â president (2000â07) * [[Ariel Sharon]] â prime minister (2001â06) * [[Ehud Olmert]] â prime minister (2006â09); former mayor of Jerusalem * [[Rehavam Zeevi]] â founder of the Moledet party (assassinated October 2001) * [[Yossi Beilin]] â leader of the [[Meretz-Yachad]] party and peace negotiator * [[Yosef Lapid]] â former leader of the [[Shinui]] party * [[Teddy Kollek]] â former mayor of [[Jerusalem]] * [[Effie Eitam]] â former leader of the [[National Religious Party]] party, now head of the [[Renewed Religious National Zionist party]] * [[Ovadia Yosef|Rabbi Ovadia Yosef]] â spiritual leader of the [[Shas]] party
===Military=== [[File:Ilan Ramon, NASA photo portrait in orange suit.jpg|thumb|180px|[[Ilan Ramon]]]] * [[Ron Arad (pilot)|Ron Arad]] â MIA navigator * [[Gabi Ashkenazi]] â former [[Ramatkal|Chief of the IDF General Staff]] * [[Yohai Ben-Nun]] â sixth commander of the [[Israeli Navy]] * [[Eli Cohen]] â spy * [[Wolfgang Lotz]] â spy * [[Moshe Dayan]] â military leader * [[Giora Epstein]] â combat pilot, modern-day "[[flying ace|ace of aces]]" * [[Dan Halutz]] â Chief of the IDF General Staff (2005â07) * [[Uziel Gal]] â designer of the [[Uzi]] submachine gun * [[Peter Malkin|Tzvi Malkhin]] â [[Mossad]] agent, captured [[Adolf Eichmann]] * [[Yonatan Netanyahu]] â [[Sayeret Matkal]] commando, leader of [[Operation Entebbe]] * [[Ilan Ramon]] â astronaut on [[Space Shuttle Columbia|Columbia]] flight [[STS-107]] * [[Gilad Shalit]] â kidnapped soldier held in Gaza * [[Avraham Stern]] â underground military leader * [[Israel Tal]] â general, father of [[Merkava]] tank
===Activists=== * [[Uri Avnery]] â peace activist, [[Gush Shalom]] * [[Yael Dayan]] â writer, politician, activist * [[Michael Dorfman]] Russian-Israeli essayist and human rights activist * [[Uzi Even]] â gay rights activist * [[Uri Savir]], peace negotiator, [[Peres Center for Peace]] * [[Israel Shahak]] â political activist * [[Natan Sharansky]] â Soviet-era human rights activist
===Criminals=== {{see also|Category:Israeli criminals}} * [[Ami Popper]] â murdered 7 Arabs * [[Baruch Goldstein]] â massacred 29 Arabs in the [[Cave of the Patriarchs]] * [[Benny Sela]] â convicted rapist and escapee * [[Eden-Nathan Zada]] â army defector who killed 4 people and wounded many others on a bus in Shfar'am * [[Yigal Amir]] â assassin of [[Yitzhak Rabin]]
==Religious figures== ===Haredi rabbis=== * [[Avraham Yeshayeh Karelitz]], ''Chazon Ish'', (1878â1953) * [[Elazar Menachem Shach]], ''Rav Shach'', (1899â2001) * [[Moshe Shmuel Shapira]], [[rosh yeshiva]] of Beer Yaakov * [[Mordechai Eliyahu]], Sephardi Chief Rabbi of Israel 1983â93, (1929â2010) * [[Nissim Karelitz]], Head Justice of Rabbinical Court of [[Bnei Brak]] * [[Chaim Kanievsky]] * [[Ovadia Yoseph]] * [[Yosef Sholom Eliashiv]] * [[Shlomo Zalman Auerbach]] * [[Yosef Chaim Sonnenfeld]], Chief Rabbi of Jerusalem ([[Edah HaChareidis]]) * [[Yitzchok Tuvia Weiss]], Chief Rabbi of Jerusalem ([[Edah HaChareidis]]) * [[Yosef Tzvi Dushinsky (I)]], Chief Rabbi of Jerusalem ([[Edah HaChareidis]]) * [[Yaakov Aryeh Alter]], [[Ger (Hasidic dynasty)|Gerrer]] Rebbe * [[Yissachar Dov Rokeach (II)]], [[Belz (Hasidic dynasty)|Belzer]] Rebbe
===Religious-Zionist rabbis=== * [[Avraham Yitzchak Kook]], pre-state Ashkenazic Chief Rabbi of the Land of Israel,<ref>Even though the State of Israel did not yet exist at the time of his death, he is commonly referred to as the first Ashkenazic Chief Rabbi of the State of Israel.</ref> (1865â1935) * [[Shlomo Amar]], Sephardic Chief Rabbi of Israel * [[Yona Metzger]], Ashkenazic Chief Rabbi of Israel * [[Israel Meir Lau]] Ashkenazic Chief Rabbi of Israel (1993â2003), Chief Rabbi of Netanya (1978â88), (1937â) * [[Aharon Lichtenstein]] * [[David Hartman (rabbi)|David Hartman]] * [[Shlomo Riskin]] Ashkenazic Chief Rabbi of Efrat
==Cultural figures== ===Film, TV, and stage=== {{see also|List of Israeli actors}} [[File:Avital Abargil.jpg|thumb|160px|[[Avital Abergil]]]] [[File:Aki Avni.jpg|thumb|160px|[[Aki Avni]]]] [[File:Natalie Portman - TIFF2010 01.jpg|thumb|160px|[[Natalie Portman]]]] * [[Avital Abergel]] â film and TV actress * [[Gila Almagor]] â actress * [[Lior Ashkenazi]] â actor * [[Yvan Attal]] â actor, director (Israeli-born) * [[Mili Avital]] â actress * [[Aki Avni]] â actor * [[David Faitelson]] â Mexican television sports commentator (Israeli-born) * [[Oded Fehr]] â actor * [[Eytan Fox]] â director * [[Uri Geller]] â TV personality, self-proclaimed psychic * [[Amos Gitai]] â director * [[Michael Karpin]] â broadcast journalist and author * [[Daphna Kastner]], actress; married to actor [[Harvey Keitel]] * [[Amos Kollek]] â director, writer * [[Dover Kosashvili]] â director * [[Hanna Laslo]] â actress * [[Daliah Lavi]] â actress * [[Rod Lurie]] â director, film critic (Israeli-born) * [[Gad Lerner]] â journalist (currently living in Italy) * [[Arnon Milchan]] â producer * [[Ohad Naharin]] â choreographer * [[Eyal Podell]] â actor * [[Natalie Portman]] â actress (Israeli-born) * [[Ze'ev Revach]] - actor and comedian * [[Avner Strauss]] â musician * [[Haim Saban]] â TV producer * [[Elia Suleiman]] â director * [[Chaim Topol]] â actor * [[Raviv Ullman]] â actor (Israeli-born) * [[Haim Yavin]] â long-serving TV anchor * [[Keren Yedaya]] â director * [[Ayelet Zurer]] â actress * [[Naor Zion]] â comedian/actor/director

==Academic figures== {{see also|List of Members of the Israel Academy of Sciences and Humanities}}
===Computing and mathematics=== [[File:Shafi Goldwasser.JPG|thumb|160px|[[Shafi Goldwasser]]]] [[File:Elon Lindenstrauss MFO.jpg|thumb|160px|[[Elon Lindenstrauss]]]] * [[Ron Aharoni]] â mathematician * [[Noga Alon]] â mathematician, computer scientist, winner of the [[GÃ¶del Prize]] (2005) * [[Shimshon Amitsur]]- mathematician [[ring theory]] [[abstract algebra]] * [[Robert Aumann]] â mathematical [[game theory]]; [[Nobel Prize]] in [[Economics]] (2005) * [[Amir Ban]] and [[Shay Bushinsky]] â programmers of [[Junior (chess)]] * [[Moshe Bar]] â creator and main developer of [[openMosix]] * [[Yehoshua Bar-Hillel]] â machine translation * [[Joseph Bernstein]] â mathematician * [[Eli Biham]] â [[differential cryptanalysis]] * [[Aryeh Dvoretzky]], mathematician * [[Uriel Feige]] â computer scientist, winner of the [[GÃ¶del Prize]](2001) * [[Abraham Fraenkel]] â [[Zermelo-Fraenkel set theory|ZF]] set theory * [[Hillel Furstenberg]] â mathematician; [[Wolf Prize in Mathematics]] (2006/7) * [[Shafi Goldwasser]] â computer scientist, winner of the [[GÃ¶del Prize]] (1993 and 2001) * [[David Harel]] â computer science; [[Israel Prize]] (2004) * [[Abraham Lempel]] and [[Jacob Ziv]] â [[LZW]] compression; [[IEEE Richard W. Hamming Medal]] (2007 and 1995) * [[Joram Lindenstrauss]] â mathematician [[JohnsonâLindenstrauss lemma]] * [[Elon Lindenstrauss]] â mathematician [[the 2010 Fields Medal awarded]] * [[Michel LoÃ¨ve]] â probabilist * [[Joel Moses]] â MIT provost and writer of [[Macsyma]] * [[Yoram Moses]] â computer scientist, winner of the(1997) * [[Judea Pearl]] â artificial intelligence, philosophy of action * [[Ilya Piatetski-Shapiro]] â representation theory; [[Wolf Prize in Mathematics]] (1990) * [[Amir Pnueli]] â temporal logic; [[Turing Award]] (1996) * [[Michael O. Rabin]] â nondeterminism, primality testing; Turing Award (1976) * [[Shmuel Safra]] â computer scientist, winner of the (2001) * [[Nir Shavit]]- computer scientist, winner of the (2001) * [[Adi Shamir]] â [[RSA (algorithm)|RSA]] encryption, differential cryptanalysis; Turing Award (2002) * [[Saharon Shelah]] â logic; Wolf Prize in Mathematics (2001) * [[Ehud Shapiro]] â Concurrent Prolog, DNA computing pioneer * [[Moshe Y. Vardi]] â computer scientist, winner of the(2000) * [[Avi Wigderson]] â randomized algorithms; [[Nevanlinna Prize]] (1994) * [[Doron Zeilberger]] â combinatorics
===Physics and chemistry=== [[File:Professor Joe Imry.jpg|thumb| right| 160px |[[Josef Imry]]]] * [[Yakir Aharonov]] â [[Aharonov-Bohm effect]]; [[Wolf Prize in Physics]] (1998) * [[Jacob Bekenstein]] â black hole thermodynamics * [[David Deutsch]] â quantum computing pioneer; [[Dirac Prize|Paul Dirac Prize]] (1998) * [[Joshua Jortner]] and [[Raphael David Levine|Rafi Levine]] â molecular energy; [[Wolf Prize in Chemistry]] (1988) * [[Josef Imry]], physicist * [[Aaron Katzir]], physical chemistry, * [[Ephraim Katzir]] â immobilized enzymes; [[Japan Prize]] (1985) The fourth President of Israel [[List of Presidents of Israel]] * [[Zvi Lipkin]], physicist * [[Mordehai Milgrom]] â Modified Newtonian Dynamics ([[Modified Newtonian Dynamics|MOND]]) * [[Yuval Ne'eman]] â the "[[Eightfold way (physics)|Eightfold way]]" * [[Asher Peres]] â quantum theory * [[Giulio Racah]] â spectroscopy * [[Nathan Rosen]] â EPR paradox * [[Nathan Seiberg]] â string theory * [[Dan Shechtman]] â [[quasicrystal]]s; Wolf Prize in Physics (1999) * [[Igal Talmi]], particle physics * [[Reshef Tenne]] â discovered inorganic fullerenes and [[inorganic nanotube]]s * [[Chaim Weizmann]] â acetone production
===Biology and medicine=== [[File:Nobel2004chemistrylaurets-Ciehanover.jpg|thumb|160px|[[Aaron Ciechanover]]]] * [[Aaron Ciechanover]] and [[Avram Hershko]] â ubiquitin system; [[Albert Lasker Award for Basic Medical Research|Lasker Award]] (2000), [[Nobel Prize in Chemistry]] (2004) * [[Moshe Feldenkrais]] â invented [[Feldenkrais method]] used in movement therapy * [[Lior Gepstein]] â American College of Cardiology's Zipes Award for his development of heart cells and pacemakers from stem cells.<ref name="ynetnews1">{{cite web | url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3395347,00.html | title=The World Salutes Four Israeli Scientists | accessdate=2007-05-05}}</ref> * [[Eyal Gur]] â selected by [[Newsweek]] as one of the world's top microsurgeons <ref name="ynetnews1"/> * [[Hossam Haick]] â inventor of an electric nose for diagnosis of cancer <ref name="ynetnews1"/> * [[Israel Hanukoglu]] â structures of cytoskeletal keratins, NADP binding proteins, steroidogenic enzymes, Epithelial Sodium Channels (ENaC) * [[Gavriel Iddan]] â inventor of capsule endoscopy * [[Benjamin Kahn]] â marine biologist, defender of the Red Sea reef * [[Andy Lehrer]], entomologist * [[Shulamit Levenberg]] â inventor of a muscle tissue which isn't rejected by the body after transplant. Selected by Scientific American as one of the 50 leading scientists in the world.<ref name="ynetnews1"/> * [[Alexander Levitzki]] â cancer research; [[Wolf Prize in Medicine]] (2005) * [[Gideon Mer]] â Scientist, malaria control * [[Saul Merin]] â Ophthalmologist, author of Inherited Eye Diseases * [[Raphael Mechoulam]] â Chemist, discoverer of [[tetrahydrocannabinol]] and [[anandamide]] * [[Leo Sachs]] â blood cell research; Wolf Prize in Medicine (1980) * [[Michael Sela]] and [[Ruth Arnon]] â developed [[Copaxone]]; Wolf Prize in Medicine (1998) * [[Joel Sussman]] â 3D structure of acetylcholinesterase, Elkeles Prize for Research in Medicine (2005) *[[Valero Aaron]]-Professor of Medicine, founder of Faculty of Medicine at the Technion, director of government hospital * [[Meir Wilchek]] â affinity chromatography; Wolf Prize in Medicine (1987) * [[Ada Yonath]] â structure of ribosome. She received the Nobel Prize in Chemistry (2009) * [[Amotz Zahavi]] â [[Handicap Principle]]

Lewin]] â founder of [[Akamai Technologies]] * [[Bob Rosenschein]] â founder of [[GuruNet]], [[Answers.com]] (Israeli-based) * [[Gil Schwed]] â founder of [[Check Point Software Technologies|Check Point]] * [[Zeev Suraski]] and [[Andi Gutmans]] â founders of [[Zend Technologies]] (developers of [[PHP]]) * [[Arik Vardi|Arik]] and [[Yossi Vardi]], [[Yair Goldfinger]], [[Sefi Vigiser]] and [[Amnon Amir]] â founders of [[Mirabilis (company)|Mirabilis]] (developers of [[ICQ]])
